alert.note: Alert for Hitchcock; Red Willow (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 3:08PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Red Willow and northeastern Hitchcock Counties through 345 PM CDT... At 308 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles southeast of Culbertson to near McCook to near Indianola to near Lebanon. Movement was northwest at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... McCook around 315 PM CDT. Culbertson around 325 PM CDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
